intro: Cayratia hayatae, commonly known as the Hawaiian climbing vine, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a perennial vine characterized by its slender, twining stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruit is a small, smooth, green berry that turns red when mature. Cayratia hayatae is native to the Hawaiian Islands and is adapted to the tropical climate of the region.
